byline.original: By JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG and MICHAEL CORKERY

abstract: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, agency within Health and Human Services Dept, issues rule forbidding nursing homes that receive federal funding from requiring residents to resolve disputes in private arbitration; rule is designed to deliver major new protections to 1.5 million nursing home residents.

headline.print_headline: No Arbitration, U.S. Agency Tells Nursing Homes
headline.main: U.S. Just Made It a Lot Less Difficult to Sue Nursing Homes

keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: The decision, by the Department of Health and Human Services, would restore the right to legal action to 1.5 million nursing home residents....
